caption:
Compilation of Villanelle’s Kills from Season 1 and 2 - from Viktor Kedrun to Raymond. 

From Season 1, Jodie’s favorite kill was Inga. What’s yours? 
“My favorite kill was the one with Inga in the prison cell, where she bites her neck…That kill was so feral and brutal.”

blog.name: villanelleismyeviltwin
blog.title: Killing Eve is My Obsession
blog.description: Villaneve obsess with each other. I’m obsessed with them, especially Villanelle. She is my evil twin and I love her to the moon and back! Everything on this show is fucking genius! So, this blog is dedicated to anything related to Killing Eve, Jodie Comer, and Sandra Oh only — not multi-fandom. If you’re looking for Killing Eve stuff, just get on board. I make gifsets when I have free time. Visit My Site if you'd like. I do some shitty stuff there LOL!

summary: Me: Trying to figure out Killing Eve sub plot.
title: Me: Trying to figure out Killing Eve sub plot.
body:
1. How The Twelve connects to The Peels? If they want Alister Peel die, why didn’t let Villanelle kill him since the first season? Or they had no clue at that moment that what The Pharaday run by Aaron would sell the weapon?

2. Aaron Peel had hired The Ghost to kill his father and those who were close to him and didn’t agree with his plan to sell the weapon for the last over 10 months? Why the Twelve didn’t know about that until this season? Because Aaron didn’t announce it publicly?

3. How Nadia (no offend but she’s not as half smart or good at her job as Villanelle) knew the importance of Alister Peel, but Villanelle didn’t?

4. The Twelve and MI6 were afraid that the weapon Aaron had on them would massively affect them, so they used Eve and Villanelle to kill Aaron?

5. The Twelve wants Eve and Villanelle dead, and now what?

2. Aaron Peel had hired The Ghost to kill his father and those who were close to him and didn’t agree with his plan to sell the weapon for the last over 10 months? Why the Twelve didn’t know about that until this season? Because Aaron didn’t announce it publicly?

blog.name: raechellenoelle
blog.title: TV Talk
blog.description: a newsletter about tv but on tumblr

tags: what we do in the shadows
title: TV Talk: Issue 29
body:
Watching

Holy shit the second season of Fleabag was amazing. Phoebe Waller-Bridge is delightful and I love her. I’m also in love with the priest. Thank god Phoebe gave us a second season! Watch it on Amazon.

OMFG that Killing Eve season finale! I won’t give away any spoilers, but damn what an incredible show.

iZombie season 5 premiered on the CW and it’s zombies versus humans. There’s a shortage of brains in the quarantined city of Seattle after people finally realize that zombies exist. I’m not as into the zombies versus humans thing, but I still love the brain cooking sequences. If they just did a cooking show about brains, I’d probably love it.  

There was another amazing episode of What We Do in the Shadows on FX where the vampires try to host a vampire orgy. It doesn’t really go as planned.

Jane the Virgin is such a great fucking show. I don’t want to say anything about it, because it’s too easy to spoil. Just watch it on the CW.

I watched the utterly maddening Catch-22 miniseries on Hulu. It was absurd and funny sometimes, but mostly it was devastating and frustrating. The show focuses on the bombardier John Yossarian played by Christopher Abbott, yet another (and possibly the hottest) famous Chris. Nicknamed Yo-Yo, the hot bombardier spends most of his time trying to go home only for his plans to be foiled by the circular logic of war every time he comes close. There are only six episodes and it is very well done.

summary: Your responses are always great ☺️ but Konstantin should know better that getting rid of Eve wouldn’t make Villanelle work the...
question: Your responses are always great ☺️ but Konstantin should know better that getting rid of Eve wouldn’t make Villanelle work the way he wants her too anyway. It is still selfish and thoughtless in my view. She won’t forget about her. She’ll still want her or someone, the way she still dreamt of Anna or looks at women in the very first episode.
answer: I agree with you that he is selfish and he should know that Villanelle wouldn’t just get over Eve so easily. But I also see him as that parent who doesn’t approve of his child’s girlfriend/boyfriend and he tend to intervene in his child’s love life more than he should lol. I don’t defend him by any means! Just trying to see his point of view. Ultimately his priority will always be himself and his real family which hurts a little, because I really like Villanelle and Konstantin’s father/daughter dynamic.

reblog.comment: I agree with you that he is selfish and he should know that Villanelle wouldn’t just get over Eve so easily. But I also see him as that parent who doesn’t approve of his child’s girlfriend/boyfriend and he tend to intervene in his child’s love life more than he should lol. I don’t defend him by any means! Just trying to see his point of view. Ultimately his priority will always be himself and his real family which hurts a little, because I really like Villanelle and Konstantin’s father/daughter dynamic.

blog.name: agentpolastri
blog.title: parfum villanelle
blog.description: mei. she/her. bi. 18. 80% killing eve & 20% shitposts/misc. formerly vonfey.

summary: I find it very telling that some fans claim it is not about S/Eve race. That V is closer in age, etc and Sandra is older.  The...
question: I find it very telling that some fans claim it is not about S/Eve race. That V is closer in age, etc and Sandra is older.  The some fans drool over other white middle aged actresses.  Fans can be very aggressive towards Sandra (latest interview, awards, etc). I suspect that this aggression is due to the fact that they wish to be the object of V’s affections and are using Eve as a stand in.  Maybe I’m reaching, but I feel like it’s harder for them to picture this because Eve is a middle aged WOC.
answer:
yeah, in my last ask i didn’t focus on the race aspect as much. referring to my original post yesterday about the poll gap—some fans have gotten weirdly defensive over it. i believe fandoms in general have an underlying problem pertaining to race and age. it’s a broad statement to make, admittedly, but racism and ageism are definitive issues that are present today. some may not like that sandra oh/eve is confronting and breaking down these conventional barriers in her stride—she’s a woman, she’s a person of color, she’s older, and there are wlw elements. however, if fans are looking for something conventional, they’re watching the wrong show.

i’m not sure about the stand-in part? you could reduce it to extreme admiration for villanelle/jodie, but it’s an interesting thought nonetheless!

on a serious note—i agree. idk. i’m not completely unsympathetic! villanelle is a great character and jodie really brings her to life on the big screen. however, that’s not to say that eve and Sandra’s take on her isn’t interesting on its own as well. i had a convo w one of my friends about it yesterday and we agreed that it really came down to a) relatability and b) face value of the character.

villanelle’s popularity is definitely bolstered by the fact that she appeals to the target audience more than eve. she’s young, dramatic, has tons of entertainment value, and jodie is incredibly attractive! not to mention she’s white. that’s not the main focus of my argument, but I’m not naive enough to think that doesn’t play a part in SOME people’s preference. in constrast to villanelle, eve’s entire character is more subtle, and i think that’s the point. she’s a middle aged woman working a desk job who’s married (sort of) and is a woc. who is going to appeal to a demographic of young adults more? young assassin with a flair for the dramatic or middle aged woman with a desk job? probably the former.

still, i was disappointed that the gap wasn’t smaller. i expected more people to be interested in eve’s development and underlying conflicts—and not to be so shallow(?) about it, which brings me to face value of the character.

villanelle’s character is naturally able to catch the audience’s attention through how loud her personality is. that’s how she is—she’s meant to be exciting and yada yada yada. interesting. when rwe look at eve, however, she’s quieter. subtler. and i think some people tend to overlook how valuable eve is to the show simply because of that. villanelle says at one point to eve, “the only thing that makes you interesting is me” (along those lines i just woke up)—and I think some people truly believed that. but we know this to be wrong! eve was beginning to toe that slippery slope regardless of villanelle’s presence at the beginning of the show. the point is that while eve is initially unassuming, she is a very complicated and nuanced character who is also being under appreciated while simultaneously being the title character.

anyways, that isn’t to say i hate villanelle! I love both characters dearly and I’ve been an advocate for not having a favorite/not pitting jodie and Sandra against each other for ages. i was just disappointed in the disparity between eve and villanelle in the polls—never mind that it was on eve’s twitter account.

blog.name: labdakos-sfw
blog.title: Art's SFW Random Pics & Quips
blog.description:
Gay geek with a degree in chemistry, couch potato, and atheist.

If you're an adult and interested in that sort of thing: all these posts can also be found on my main blog Art's Random Pics and Quips -- with the addition of loads of naked men, some of them doing naughty things.

summary:
LGBTQ+ Characters on TV
 To be specific, these are regular or recurring characters who have been (re-)introduced or revealed as...
caption:
LGBTQ+ Characters on TV

To be specific, these are regular or recurring characters who have been (re-)introduced or revealed as being LGBTQ+ during the 2018/19 TV season. (Or whom I’ve only just learned about or whom I hadn’t mentioned in previous posts of this type. Needless to say that this list is highly arbitrary and incomplete.)

Killing Eve (BBC)

  • Villanelle (portrayed by Jodie Comer)

Krypton (Syfy)

  • Nyssa-Vex (portrayed by Wallis Day)

Future Man (Hulu)

  • Elias Kronish (portrayed by Keith David)

Grantchester (ITV)

  • Leonard Finch (portrayed by Al Weaver)
  • Daniel Marlowe (portrayed by Oliver Dimsdale)

Mindhunter (Netflix)

  • Wendy Carr (portrayed by Anna Torv)
  • Annaliese Stilman (portrayed by Lena Olin)

(The “Goodie of the Day” is a daily feature of my tumblr. This can be anything that’s likely to improve my mood, and I hope it works the same way for some of you. Enjoy!

Like in previous years, I’m doing “Goodie of the Day” posts for June that are dedicated to the celebration of LGBTQ Pride.)
